messages.text: Thanks, David — early is often the best time to get involved.Yes, we’ve worked with distributed teams in logistics and supply chain — UPS, DHL, and others. I’d be happy to tailor the conversation to your needs.How’s Tuesday at 11 a.m. PST?Best,Bruce
messages.intent: confirm availability, address concern, propose meeting

messages.text: Tuesday 11 a.m. works. Please send the invite.In the meantime, feel free to share any material that outlines how your CRM handles multiple business units. That’s been a sticking point for us with other platforms.– David
messages.intent: confirm meeting, request info, raise concern

messages.text: Calendar invite sent!Attaching a 1-pager that highlights how we segment permissions, reporting, and workflows across business units — particularly helpful for teams like yours that manage both B2B and B2C flows.Talk soon,Bruce
messages.intent: fulfill request, confirm meeting, address objection

messages.text: Thanks Bruce — got the doc. Some good points in there.Let’s cover ease of integration on the Slack. That’s another area where we’ve hit snags in the past.Looking forward to learning more.Best,David
messages.intent: acknowledge, raise new concern, confirm interest

summary: The sales rep, Bruce Wayne, initiated contact with David Gonzalez from FedEx regarding CRM solutions. David expressed interest and scheduled a meeting, but raised two key technical concerns: handling multiple business units and ease of integration, particularly with Slack. Bruce provided material addressing the multi-business unit concern and sent a meeting invite. The Slack integration point remains a key discussion point for the upcoming call.
